channel.title: Runescape "hacking"
channel.description:
[QUOTE=OneWhoSighs]Hello, Some of you may already know me as the founder / vice chairman of b0ts, some of you may know me as the Gunz The Duel hacker, some may know me as the coder of the Open Source ZeroX Server Emulator ( [url=http://www.b0ts.org/zerox/src]http://www.b0ts.org/zerox/src[/url] ), and then again some of you may not know me at all. I did have another account here, but I don't think the admins wanted to change my username. So I had made a new username. I don't know if anyone has ever done this before, don't care, honestly. I was asked by a bunch of people to try and hack RuneScape and not Gunz, so I gave it a try. This is my video, (Note* I am not an amazing editor, so bear with me). [B]Google Video Link:[/B] [url=http://video.google.ca/videoplay?docid=-5192707534116862241]http://video.google.ca/videoplay?docid=-5192707534116862241[/url] This was also uploaded on youtube, but removed shortly after and my e-mail was banned, and I can't upload it anymore. (The original topic was posted here on mafiacoders): [url=http://76.76.5.15/showthread.php?t=41452]http://76.76.5.15/showthread.php?t=41452[/url] If you are wondering how this is done, network interception within an injected library (into firefox). Thanks microsoft for createremotethread() ;)[/QUOTE] What are your beliefs on this? I personally believe it is not true, for this reason:
...Didn't Jagex change the way the server works so that packets, when edited and sent back, will be refused and only remain clientside if it does not match the server variables? [For example changing 1 gold piece to 10 gold pieces would only be client side] You are using much more complex examples, but it seems your "hack" is somewhat similar to autorune, which would not work because of the system change.
What are your opinions on this? Keep in mind that I do not know much on this topic :P

item.title: Runescape "hacking"
item.dc:creator: @mago_cash mago cash
item.description:
@mago_cash wrote:

[quote=“elitepvper, post:45, topic:190053”]lol there is a very easy way of proving this video wrong. I think it was made on a private server… If you look at the stats for the account. You’ll see the levels are really high and you can also see that the log out button is a door. This was changed long before this thread was started!

LOOK AGAIN![/quote]
It’s relevant to my interest, that even a retarded monkey like me, can see this is a TROLL

Read full topic

however, magicians who claim to be magic, who claim to speak with god(s), who claim to perform miracles, who claim to speak with dead people or that kind of thing are charlatans.

item.title: Runescape "hacking"
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

[quote=“oksuper_, post:39, topic:190053”][quote]<super_> Speljohan_, l
<super_> http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,253073.0.html
<super_> do i have permission 2 bump
<Speljohan_> -ChanServ- super_ added to #rsserver HOP list.
<Speljohan_> -ChanServ- super_ added to #rsbot HOP list.
<super_> since ur mod of that section
<super_> kool
<super_> thanks

  • The_Soul has quit (Client quit)
    <Speljohan_> go ahead super_ [/quote]

Wanted to bump this to point out this is POTENTIALLY possible.
If the VM used JIT and compiled it to native code, then it would have the mov cmp code. Yes, semaphore, I do see where you were coming from and I agree. Anyway, he would be able to interact with entites on his actual level if he replaced the cmp eax,2 with cmp 2,2 because the floor level field is still set to the actual value, he only modified the cmp that sees if he is on level 2 and if so, renders floor level 2. Although, I see no reason why having low-level access to packets would help. Just my two cents.[/quote]I think the fact he has idiotic buttons such as “server crash” on the application proves that infact, he didn’t do that.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape "hacking"
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

Speljohan_, l http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,253073.0.html do i have permission 2 bump -ChanServ- super_ added to #rsserver HOP list. -ChanServ- super_ added to #rsbot HOP list. since ur mod of that section kool thanks * The_Soul has quit (Client quit) go ahead super_

Wanted to bump this to point out this is POTENTIALLY possible.
If the VM used JIT and compiled it to native code, then it would have the mov cmp code. Yes, semaphore, I do see where you were coming from and I agree. Anyway, he would be able to interact with entites on his actual level if he replaced the cmp eax,2 with cmp 2,2 because the floor level field is still set to the actual value, he only modified the cmp that sees if he is on level 2 and if so, renders floor level 2. Although, I see no reason why having low-level access to packets would help. Just my two cents.

Read full topic

An actor can be a charlatan if he knows far less about his craft than he claims. This also applies to smug, useless mods that post inane comments in a pathetic attempt to insult.[/quote]

You win!

But seriously, I was just wondering how “magicians are charlatans” make sense. It only really makes sense if you were one of those people that believed in them when you were a kid and then got let down when you found out how it was all done.

item.title: Runescape "hacking"
item.dc:creator: @semaphore semaphore
item.description:
@semaphore wrote:

Mopman: Do you ever have anything to add to threads? Or do you just like to hear yourself type?

An actor can be a charlatan if he knows far less about his craft than he claims.

EDIT:

I used magician and charlatan together because another accepted definition (from the american heritage dictionary reads:

charlatan: A person who makes elaborate, fraudulent, and often voluble claims to skill or knowledge; a quack or fraud. I think it makes sense because a magician is making claims that he knows how to do something which, in reality, is a sham. Sure its loose… but I think it fits… even if only a little

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape "hacking"
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

thats his tool. looks like its made from VB6!

mov eax,dword ptr ds:[eax+0x1CC] cmp eax,2

This is modified,

mov eax,2
cmp eax,2

looks legit lol thats just like a basic if statement
if(eax == 2)
he changed it to
if(2==2)

and if what he posted is the correct offset where it takes place those 2 instructions searched together could be found I doubt i’d be hard to find a pair like that occuring more then once if u used a debugger and Searched for a sequence of commands and plug in his 2 intructions u could really check if his little exploit is real or not

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape "hacking"
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

Zouk

Zouk is a musical style originating from the Caribbean islands of Guadeloupe and Martinique and popularized by the French Antillean band Kassav' in the 1980s. Very rapid in tempo, the style lost ground in the 1980s due to the strong presence of Compas / kompa and kadans, the main music of the French Antilles. Today, zouk is the French Antilles compas (Kompa), also called zouk-love. The Creole word zouke, sekwe, or zouke, etc. from the French verb secouer meaning "shake intensely and repeatedly"...

ps. i love how you derailed your own thread
